definition: lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to fit/balanced/suitable
to weigh/to state/to name/name/appellation/to praise
variant of 秤[cheng4]/steelyard
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

sentences.english: Therefore, the non-hegemony is the inevitable choice of China for the…
sentences.chinese: 從四個方面來看，不稱霸是中國必然的選擇。

sentences.english: The sun is entering your sign, and the next four weeks will be your personal New Year.
sentences.chinese: 日座進入處女，未來四周是你稱王稱霸的日子。

sentences.english: Who says Russia's going to help China with her global ambitions?
sentences.chinese: 誰說俄羅斯會幫中國實現稱霸全球的野心啊？

sentences.english: In 1950 Britain dominated the global automotive market.
sentences.chinese: 1950年英國稱霸於全球汽車市場。

sentences.english: Did not ourselves the cubits warp, for fear to be a king.
sentences.chinese: 不正是我們自己歪曲了度量，不敢稱王稱霸。

sentences.english: Michael Jordan used to reign as the number one basketball player in NBA.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾喬丹曾是稱霸籃壇第一把交椅的球員。

sentences.english: Gone are the days when a big nation could king it over small ones.
sentences.chinese: 大國可以對小國稱王稱霸的日子已經一去不復返了。

sentences.english: China will dominate them or not after rising made them apprehensions.
sentences.chinese: 中國崛起後會不會稱霸等無不給他們疑懼。

sentences.english: They will be able to come and go without obstacles, characteristic of an army that belongs to a king or hegemon.
sentences.chinese: 能夠進退無阻的軍隊，那就是圖王稱霸的軍隊了。

sentences.english: Gone are the days when a big nation could lord it over small ones.
sentences.chinese: 大國可以對小國稱王稱霸的日子已經一去不復返了。

sentences.english: The war menace grows out of their attempt to dominate the world.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭威脅來自他們稱霸世界的企圖。

sentences.english: China will never seek hegemony and never go in for expansion.
sentences.chinese: 中國永遠不稱霸，永遠不搞擴張。

sentences.english: When he’s done, he goes to China and becomes the top man there.
sentences.chinese: 稱霸之後，他又移師中國，十年成爲業界領頭羊。

sentences.english: So English is Taking Over the Globe. So What?
sentences.chinese: 英語稱霸全球了。那有什麼了不起？

sentences.english: Quartz-crystal technology did not remain the premier frequency standard for long either, however.
sentences.chinese: 不過石英鐘技術稱霸計時標準的壽命也不長。

definition: to march/to advance
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
campaign/expedition
domain/territory
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
champion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
(ironically) mainland China (Taiwan & Hong Kong usage)
powerful country/great power
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
to occupy/to hold
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
to fight in one place after another
